page.title: 09SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Thorney Close and South Hylton Wards are two of the poorest wards in the borough. They lie to the west of the block. In 1981 unemployment reached 40% in parts of these wards as it was in the Pennywell area of the Grindon Ward. One indication of poverty might be seen from details of car ownership which is much lower than the borough average in Thorney Close and South Hylton. It is also much lower in the Central Ward but here the population is an unusual mix of students and pensioners. Ward.
